JobFullDesc: About the Role  Routematch by Uber is the leading provider of intelligent transit solutions (ITS) spanning demand response, fixed route, payment, mobility, and on-demand transit solutions. We blend powerful technology and excellent service to equip transit agencies with the right tools to provide accessibility and mobility for every rider in their community. When everyone has access to transportation, individuals, communities, and societies thrive. We're inspiring change in the transit world with new and improved products and top-notch service. We’re hiring energetic, positive professionals to contribute their talents and creativity to solutions that empower people to change their lives and get moving. Routematch is a place where you can honestly say “my work matters”. What You’ll Do Create Installation Design guides and schematics for in-vehicle hardware deployments, both aftermarket and OEMProvide hardware troubleshooting and installation-related expertise and act as the highest level of escalation for support teams by providing technical support to technicians for various installation and support activities.Work with support to document in-field issues, and resolve all hardware issues in coordination with development engineers.Test and certify new hardware for use with Routematch by Uber systems as neededManage OEM installation projects with various bus manufacturers - generate Bills of Material, coordinate orders with purchasing, and on and offsite consulting services to the bus manufacturers to ensure proper installation and configuration of equipment, including QA and commissioning servicesCoordinate order and delivery of hardware and cabling with sourcing team for new deployments. Including issuing quote requests and POs for third party contractors to perform in-vehicle hardware installations. Manage installation project administrative tasks such as organizing meetings, keeping billing milestones updated, and communicating project statusDrive great customer outcomes. Be the escalation point for our transit agency customers throughout the entirety of each project, ensuring that the agency is satisfied with our products and services.Basic Qualifications2+ years of experience in in-vehicle hardware project management/deployment or equivalent. Strong electronics background. Bonus if it is paired with software configuration and troubleshooting experience.A willingness to travel 50% of the time. This is an onsite-focused position that will take you all over North America.Strong problem-solving skills with a hands-on approach to hardware, wiring, and basic software challenges. You have the ability to lay out and test clear hypotheses, and solve problems without well-defined direction.Strong communication and organization skills, for setting expectations with clients and contractors, and escalating challenges to leadership.Strong relationship management skills. Your emotional intelligence makes it easy for you to handle sensitive discussions and navigate multiple partner engagements simultaneously.You’re a self-starter. Everywhere you go, you can't help but flex and stretch your analytical powers, pitching in as needed, and taking the initiative to seize opportunities.Preferred QualificationsElectronics Technician certificate, BSc EE or equivalent experience, engineering backgroundHands-on software deployment or troubleshooting experienceIn-Vehicle electronics installation experience
